title: How to be more empathetic

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between empathy and sympathy?

options.text: Empathy is a feeling of understanding, while sympathy is a feeling of pity.

options.label: B
options.text: Empathy fuels connection, while sympathy drives disconnection.

options.label: C
options.text: Empathy is a choice, while sympathy is an instinct.

options.label: D
options.text: Empathy is a physical response, while sympathy is an emotional response.

options.text: Perspective taking, staying out of judgment, recognising emotion in others, and communicating effectively.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Recognising emotion in others, communicating effectively, and staying out of judgment.

options.label: D
options.text: Perspective taking, recognising emotion in others, and communicating effectively.

options.label: C
options.text: Flooding the bogs and using an elevator

options.label: D
options.text: Using commercial bees to pollinate the fields

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the Ocean Spray Cooperative?

options.label: C
options.text: To grow over 60% of the world's cranberries

options.label: D
options.text: To provide financial support to cranberry farmers

title: Why do we eat spoiled food?

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of microbes found in food are harmless to humans?

What type of microbes can outcompete their dangerous relatives in food with the addition of salt?

What is a characteristic of the transformation of cacao into chocolate?

options.label: C
options.text: The cacao becomes mellow and complex

options.label: D
options.text: The cacao becomes dry and crumbly

multiple-choice.question: What is a result of mold spores populating holes and cracks in cheese?

options.label: C
options.text: The cheese becomes more aromatic and flavorful

options.label: B
options.text: The use of fermentation in food preparation

options.label: C
options.text: The use of sugar and salt in cooking

options.label: D
options.text: The use of meat and fish in meals

multiple-choice.question: What is a result of exposure to particular microbial funks?

options.label: A
options.text: People tend to dislike them more

options.label: B
options.text: People tend to like them less

options.label: C
options.text: People tend to like them more

options.label: D
options.text: People tend to be indifferent to them

multiple-choice.question: What is a consequence of not letting food spoil a little bit?

options.label: A
options.text: We would have more variety in our diets

options.label: B
options.text: We would have no sauerkraut, soy sauce, pickles, or prosciutto

options.label: C
options.text: We would have less food waste

options.label: D
options.text: We would have more money to spend on food

options.label: B

options.text: For love of meat and fish

options.label: D

title: Systemic racism explained

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why Jamal's school district is not well-funded?

options.label: A
options.text: The school district is not funded by property taxes.

options.label: B
options.text: The school district is funded by property taxes, but the property values are low.

options.label: C
options.text: The school district is funded by property taxes, but the majority of the students are African-American.

options.label: D
options.text: The school district is funded by property taxes, but the teachers are overpaid.

multiple-choice.question: What is the practice called that involved drawing maps to divide cities into sections that were either desirable or undesirable for investment?
What was one of the consequences of redlining for Jamal's grandparents?

options.label: A
options.text: They were able to buy a house with a low-interest loan.

options.label: B
options.text: They were able to attend a top university.

options.label: C
options.text: They were denied loans and unable to buy a house.

options.label: D
options.text: They were able to get a college education.

multiple-choice.question: What is implicit bias?

options.label: A
options.text: Prejudices in society that people are aware of.

options.label: B
options.text: Prejudices in society that people are not aware of.

options.label: C
options.text: Prejudices in society that only affect African-Americans.

options.label: D
options.text: Prejudices in society that only affect white people.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Jamal notice that his resume wasn't drawn as much interest as Kevin's, even though they graduated from the same program with the exact same GPA?

options.label: A
options.text: Because Kevin's resume had a different format.

options.label: B
options.text: Because Kevin's resume had more experience.

multiple-choice.question: What is one example of systemic racism in the job market?

options.label: A
options.text: The black unemployment rate is the same as the white unemployment rate.

options.label: B
options.text: The black unemployment rate is half the rate of white unemployment.

options.label: C
options.text: The black unemployment rate is twice the rate of white unemployment.

options.label: D
options.text: The black unemployment rate is not affected by implicit bias.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the ways to work towards becoming more aware of your own implicit biases?

options.label: A
options.text: By ignoring the issue of systemic racism.

options.label: B
options.text: By not discussing the issue of systemic racism.

options.label: C
options.text: By becoming more aware of your own prejudices.

multiple-choice.question: What is one systemic change that can create more equal opportunities for everyone?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing public school funding from property taxes.

options.label: B
options.text: Decreasing public school funding from property taxes.

options.label: C
options.text: Making public school funding independent from property taxes.

multiple-choice.question: Who is responsible for systemic racism?
What is the biggest challenge with systemic racism?

options.label: C
options.text: There's no single person or entity responsible for it.

title: The taxonomy of candy

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary goal of taxonomy?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a hierarchical system of classification

options.label: B
options.text: To understand the evolutionary relationships between organisms

options.label: C
options.text: To identify the characteristics of a species

multiple-choice.question: According to Margaret Thayer, what is an important aspect of classifying specimens?
What is the difference between grouping similar objects together and creating a classification system?

options.label: A
options.text: Grouping is more subjective than classification

options.label: B
options.text: Classification is more subjective than grouping

options.label: C
options.text: Grouping is based on physical characteristics, while classification is based on evolutionary relationships

options.label: D
options.text: Classification is based on colors, while grouping is based on shapes

multiple-choice.question: According to Janet Voight, what is the process of creating a classification system?

options.label: A
options.text: Slapping out a pen and paper and saying "Why are they different?"

options.label: B
options.text: Reading previously published descriptions of similar organisms

options.label: C
options.text: Obtaining specimens and observing their characteristics

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between classifying red bats and red foxes and classifying red candy?

options.label: A
options.text: Red bats and red foxes share a common ancestor, while red candy does not

options.label: B
options.text: Red bats and red foxes do not share a common ancestor, while red candy does

options.label: C
options.text: Red bats and red foxes are different species, while red candy is a single species

options.label: D
options.text: Red bats and red foxes are the same species, while red candy is different species

multiple-choice.question: According to Olivier Rieppel, what is the goal of classification in terms of organisms?

options.label: A
options.text: To bring out their physical characteristics

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the world's complexity in relation to classification?

options.label: B
options.text: B: It makes classification more challenging

options.label: C
options.text: It has no impact on classification

multiple-choice.question: According to Emily, what is the main difference between classifying candy and classifying organisms?

options.label: A
options.text: Candy is more complex than organisms

options.label: B
options.text: Organisms are more complex than candy

options.label: C
options.text: Candy is easier to classify than organisms

options.label: D
options.text: There is no difference between classifying candy and organisms

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the jelly bean family in the context of classification?
According to Olivier Rieppel, what is the relationship between humans and classification?

options.label: A
options.text: Humans bring order to the world through classification

options.label: B
options.text: The world comes to humans in an ordered way

options.label: C
options.text: There is no relationship between humans and classification

options.text: By making altars and offerings to the dead

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: As a way to ignore the dead

options.label: C
options.text: As a way to celebrate even death and honor the memories of others

title: What is echolocation?

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary method that nocturnal bats use to navigate in the dark?
What is an echo?

options.label: A
options.text: A reflection of light reaching a listener

options.label: B
options.text: A reflection of sound reaching a listener

options.label: C
options.text: A vibration that ripples away from its source in waves

multiple-choice.question: What is the rate at which a vibration occurs called?
How many waves per second can humans hear?
What is the primary sound that a bat uses to detect information about its surroundings?

options.label: C
options.text: A combination of high and low-pitched chirps

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the cartilage of the outer ear in the process of echolocation?

options.label: A
options.text: To funnel sound waves into the ear canal

options.label: B
options.text: To block sound waves from entering the ear canal

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the basilar membrane in the process of echolocation?

options.label: A
options.text: To convert vibrations into nerve impulses

options.label: B
options.text: To funnel sound waves into the ear canal

options.label: C
options.text: To block sound waves from entering the ear canal

multiple-choice.question: How do bats differentiate relevant information from signal clutter in the process of echolocation?

options.label: A
options.text: By emitting chirps of varying frequency patterns

options.label: B
options.text: By analyzing the intensity of the echoes

options.label: C
options.text: By comparing the time delay between when they hear their chirp and perceive the resulting echo

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary method that bats use to gauge the distance of an object in the process of echolocation?

options.label: A
options.text: By analyzing the intensity of the echoes

options.label: B
options.text: By comparing the time delay between when they hear their chirp and perceive the resulting echo

multiple-choice.question: What type of technology was developed from the study of echolocation in bats and whales?
